revised_title: Human Foetal Digestion and Nutritious Matter
tldr: George Robinson's study challenges Dr. Robert Lee's assertions about foetal digestion. He demonstrates that human foetuses, like those of other higher animals, have albuminous or nutritious matter that undergoes digestion in the small intestines during later intra-uterine life. The nature of this substance varies among different animals, and Robinson suggests that the salivary glands may be the source of this matter.
